name: saint
text: A comment left by saint was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by TheSheezie, Sakana, dismas, n00b, caduceo, nutmeg)

name: billyamericana
text: A comment left by billyamericana was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by kenthegod, SageinaRage, Doc_Rostov)

name: mortshire
text: Philippe has suddenly developed hella gravitas.

name: evolume
text: A comment left by evolume was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by hargbarf, glorify, habnabit)

name: hikikomori
text: Yes.

name: cdl146
text: I love how serious he gets when he says yes .

name: moraiat
text: Verily, as do I.

name: tttt
text:
Philippe's booth is set up inside the house

he can only get about five votes

name: presterjohn
text: As far as Philippe knows that's half the people in the country.

name: c_dizzle
text: He's got mine...?

name: bixschmix
text: Yes, about five votes. That is, if cats and stuffed animals can vote.

name: heccibiggs
text: So, you're implying that they can't vote, but they can run for President..?

name: atticusonline
text: you blew my mind

name: dovey
text: His FIRM belief.

name: drycup
text: I never realized how deformed Philippe's hands are until the last panel.

name: farqussus
text: Check the alt-text dude.

name: mikebox
text: Philippe is left-handed

name: epicurus
text: Panel 5 is an event that occurs once per political discussion, as a rule.

name: mountaindewtab
text: its better than the current presidents ideas on how to fix america

name: snowman
text:
Does he have an idea? I thought he was just gonna run this sumbitch into the ground...

...Bush all Strangelovin' the nation...

name: i_love_kate
text:
This has an awfully low score for a Phillipe-centric strip.

Get to righting this wrong, street team!

name: thatcrazycommie
text: I think this is *the first* Phillipe strip with a rating less than four, actually.

name: c_dizzle
text: So far I've seen poopytime and underpants time. I'm trying to see a trend. ..then again, I'm also trying DESPERATELY not to.

name: booger
text: am i childish for laughing aloud to the name "Mr. Poopytime"? keeping in mind that i barely ever legitimately laugh aloud.

name: cinderfella
text: Knocked it up to 4.0... first vote ever. I need some tequila and a guava half to celebrate.

name: tekende
text: Someday,when I have a house with a yard instead of an apartment--I will get a puppy and name him Mr. Poopytime. The name amuses me that much.

name: snowman
text: Your current house has an apartment instead of a yard?  That sounds sweet!

name: tekende
text: Yes. Unfortunately it's kind of a shitty apartment and anyway I have to rent it to old people so I can pay my bills and they don't like puppies.

name: epicurus
text: This strip does seem a little underrated to me - it has a lot of very good elements, such as the italicized "Yes", Philippe's little desk in the garage and his attempt at forthright, bottom-line dignity, and the last two panels. Actually the dialogue from the last panel has stayed in my mind since I first read this strip and I still chuckle about it, often at VERY bad times (hiding from terrorists in closet, etc. etc.)

name: redmange
text: It is my firm belief that little puppy dogs named Mr. Poopytime will raise our NHQ (National Happiness Quota), at least 43%.  We will of course have to pump money into sanitation, but this is an acceptable side effect.

name: snowman
text: Philippe closing his eyes in panel 3.

name: canusdivinus
text:
I have to wonder: how long did he sit at his little desk before someone came by?

Also, Philippe's "Yes." is one of my favorite Achewood moments of all time. Such power.

name: zapatos
text: It is an ill-omened name.  A friend of mine came over with her Mr.Puddles.  Mr.Puddles shat on my floor.  Mr.Puddles is no longer welcome in my home.  She should have named him FuckYouStu.

name: snookybutts
text: amazing strip.  easy 5

name: aperson
text: Phillipe has celebrity endorsement.

name: fineoakstructure
text: Uhh

name: aperson
text:
{nods}

Yup.
